page.title: 08TOURISM NEAR SANDHEAD
page.content: by Elizabeth Sime aged 10 Sandhead is very popular with tourists. There are two very nice campsites about one kilometre from Sandhead. I am the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sime, the people who own one of the campsites. We have new showers in just this week. There is a playpark for the children. There are toilets, a laundry, a washing-up place, a shop that sells most things and a beautiful big beach. Along the beach from us are some sand-dunes. We play there a lot, jumping off them and sliding down them. The camp-site is called Sands Of Luce Caravan Park. We take tents and touring caravans, and we allow dogs as well, but they must be on a lead on the site. There are lovely walks to go on. Stranraer is about nine kilometres from our Caravan Park. We came from Glasgow last year and we love it here.
